result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:03 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gabriel Alejandro Beltran-Vega in court.  Attorney Luke K Harrison in court for Gabriel Alejandro Beltran-Vega. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-28-22 at 11:00 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.
--Beatriz Mena, 909 S. 20th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. felony bail jumping and misdemeanor bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-21-22 at 1:30 pm.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
